meanings.definition: A board or plank used to cover the projecting rafter of a gable.
meanings.sent1: The bargeboards protected the edges of the roof.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter nailed the bargeboards onto the roof's edge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the bargeboards as a slide.
meanings.sent4: The bargeboards stood like guardians at the edge of the roof.
meanings.sent5: Painting the bargeboards a bright color added charm to the house.

meanings.definition: A board attached to the projecting gable of a roof to give strength and support.
meanings.sent1: The old house had sturdy bargeboards to support the roof.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter reinforced the gable with new bargeboards.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the bargeboards, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The bargeboards held up the roof like strong pillars.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled through the gaps in the bargeboards during the storm.
